greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Gamma(1/4)^4/(4*Pi^3).
comment: This is also the value of F. Morley's series from 1902 Sum_{k=0..n} (risefac(k,1/2)/k!)^3 = hypergeometric([1/2,1/2,1/2],[1,1],1) with the rising factorial risefac(n,x). See A277232, also for the Hardy reference and a MathWorld link. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Nov 11 2016
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
A. M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972, p. 256, 6.1.17 , p. 557, 15.1.26.
M. L. Glasser, I. J. Zucker, Extended Watson integrals for the cubic lattices, Proc. Nat. Acad. Sci., Vol. 74, No. 5 (1977), p. 1800-1801.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Watson's Triple Integrals.
I. J. Zucker, 70+years of the Watson integrals, J. Stat. Phys., Vol. 145, No. 3 (2011), pp. 591-612.
formula: Equals Gamma(1/4)^4 / (4*Pi^3) = Pi / (Gamma(3/4))^4 = hypergeom([1/2,1/2],[1],1/2)^2, see the two Abramowitz - Stegun references. (End)
Equals the square of A175574. Equals A000796/A068465^4. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 17 2016
mathematica: RealDigits[ N[ Gamma[1/4]^4/(4*Pi^3), 102]][[1]] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 12 2012, after _Eric W. Weisstein_ *)
program: (MAGMA) SetDefaultRealField(RealField(100)); R:= RealField(); Gamma(1/4)^4/(4*Pi(R)^3); // _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 26 2018
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Jan 27 2004
